title: Add Loading State to HTMX Forms with Alpine.js
content:
Context
I have a FastAPI + HTMX + Alpine.js web application. I want to add loading states to forms that submit via HTMX so users see visual feedback (button text changes, button gets disabled) while the request is processing.

Requirements

Add loading states to the following forms:

1. Create form in templates/index.html
2. Edit form in templates/components/prompt_card.html

Implementation Steps

For each form, make these changes:

1. Add Alpine.js loading state to the <form> tag:
html
Note: If the form already has @htmx:after-request with other code, append loading = false; to the beginning of that code.

2. Update the submit button:
html
3. Optionally disable the cancel button during loading:
html
Alpine.js Directives Used

•  x-data="{ loading: false }" - Creates a reactive loading state
•  @htmx:before-request - HTMX event that fires before sending request
•  @htmx:after-request - HTMX event that fires after request completes
•  :disabled="loading" - Binds the disabled attribute to loading state
•  :class - Dynamically adds CSS classes based on state
•  x-show - Shows/hides elements based on condition

Expected Behavior

•  When user clicks submit, button text changes from "Save" to "Saving..."
•  Button becomes disabled and visually grayed out (opacity-50)
•  Cancel button also becomes disabled to prevent conflicts
•  After server responds, button returns to normal state
•  Works for both successful and failed requests

Files to Modify

1. templates/index.html - The create form (around line 25-70)
2. templates/components/prompt_card.html - The edit form (around line 32-73)
